newsitem.title: USA: Calif. upgrades may not be realistic - Treasurer.
newsitem.headline: Calif. upgrades may not be realistic - Treasurer.

text.p: California Treasurer Matt Fong said on Wednesday he had "positive" meetings with major credit rating agencies in New York but added that it may not be realistic to expect rating upgrades at this time.

"The input from the rating agencies on this trip was more positive than we've heard from past trips," Fong told reporters in a conference call from New York, where he met this week with officials from major credit rating agencies.
"Having just received an upgrade last year, it may be unrealistic to expect one back to back," Fong said. "But I'm always optimistic."
Fong said the rating agencies had expressed some reservations about the state's budget reserve and the ability of lawmakers to adjust budget spending if the economy sours.
"But overall ... they were all impressed and surprised that California's recovery was stronger and quicker than any had anticipated," Fong said.
